intro: Streblacanthus macrophyllus, commonly known as the giant leaf streblacanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its botanical classification places it within the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. Due to its unique foliage and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
